div.i: Written entirely in HTML and CSS!

div.p: Here are some of my various projects!
A Resource Pack that allows you to load Resource Packs from 1.13 and beyond.
Run the latest version on 128MB of memory!
A modpack focused on ease of use, customization, simplicity and external launcher compatibility.
I've always been interested in operating systems.

With Windows, I know the OS pretty much inside out. Windows has lots of interesting things behind the normal view, like legacy features (basic theme, old icons in DLL files, etc.), utilities and more.

A few months ago I switched to Linux, due to Windows having random driver issues, slowdown, bugs and general stability issues. All of my applications worked perfectly and everything worked perfectly on Linux Mint. After that I switched to Arch, which greatly improved boot times (takes less than 10 seconds to boot!), and worked with me a lot better. So far with Arch I've had no issues whatsoever and I'm extremely happy.

Older operating systems also interest me. I like Windows 3.1, 2000, Vista and Windows 8.1. I also like old computers like the C64, NES and PC Engine (also known as the Turbografx-16), but nowadays I hate consoles due to me finding them to be absolutely useless.

A few months ago I learned web development. It ended up becoming something that I love to do in my free time. Web development is interesting due to its process of trial and error and finding solutions. My most recent website redesign focused on browser backwards compatibility, specifically with IE6.
Recently I've been focusing more on web development, Minecraft projects in Java, and other things, but here's some basic information.

I've been messing around with Minecraft since 2020, and it's definitely been the journey having fun with it. One other game that I play, Geometry Dash, I've been playing for over 6 years. With update 2.2, the game will change forever.
I tend to be super inactive and disorganized with certain things, due to my nature to keep things incredibly peaceful.
